moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bc4: The "Quiet Game"... but not this time!
moves.3... Nf6: Black's aggressive defense leads to the fireworks starting early.
moves.4. d3 Bc5 5. Bg5: White is not afraid to mix it up!
moves.5... O-O 6. Nc3 d6 7. Nd5: A sharp thrust. White decides to try and press the attack.
moves.7... Kh8: Black tucks his King in what he thinks is a safe corner.
moves.8. Bxf6 gxf6: Opens the K position up, but there is no other choice.
moves.9. Qd2 f5: Black attempts to slow White's coming charge.
moves.10. Qh6 f6: Attempting to keep White's KN fron KN5.
moves.11. Nh4: White finds a different spot for the Knight.
moves.11... Rf7: Black tries to get his R and Q involved in the defense. Now the Q can move to B1 and attempt to break White's attack by offering the exchange of Queens.
moves.12. Ng6+: White takes advantage of the pin on Black's KRP to force home his attack before Black can marshal his defenses.
moves.13. Nxf6+: This move exploits another pin -- this one on the Black KR -- to divert the Q from guarding the back rank.
moves.14. Qf8#: ...White's Q can finish the game in style with this mate.
